Module src
Package BoardDrawingGame.logic

Class Game

java.lang.Object
BoardDrawingGame.logic.Game
public class Game extends Object
The Game class represents the game logic for a Dots and Boxes game. It manages player turns, moves, scores, and the overall state of the game. The game supports different game modes, including Player vs Player, Player vs AI, and AI vs AI, in offline mode.
Author:
Ali Kaan Uysal, Bas Van Dijk

  • Constructor Details

    • Game

      public Game()
      Default constructor for the Game class. It initializes a new game board and utility.

      Parameters:
      gameMode - The game mode to set.

      Gets the utility class associated with the current game instance.

      Gets the current game mode.
      Returns:

      Gets the current player whose turn it is.
      Returns:

    • setMoveMadeListener

      public void setMoveMadeListener(MoveMadeListener moveMadeListener)
      Sets a listener for the GUI to be notified when a move is made or when the game is over.
      Parameters:
      moveMadeListener - The listener to set.

    • setUpGameDEMO

      public void setUpGameDEMO(Board board, Utility utility)
      Sets up the game with the chosen game mode, by setting its players.
      Parameters:
      board - The game board to set up for the players.
      utility - The utility class for game-related operations.

    • startGame

      public void startGame()
      Starts the game by initializing the board, utility, and players. It also sets up the game loop.

    • callAIMove

      public void callAIMove()
      Calls the AI move if the current player is an AIPlayer in a Player vs. AI mode.

    • processMove

      public void processMove()
      Processes the move for the current player, updating the board, scores, and notifying the listener.

    • gameIsOver

      public void gameIsOver()
      Handles the game over scenario, stops the timelines, and prints the final scores and winner.

    • isGameOver

      public boolean isGameOver()
      Checks if the game is over.
      Returns:
      boolean, true if the game is over.

    • resetGame

      public void resetGame()
      Resets the game by stopping timelines and resetting game variables.

    • getScorePlayer1

      public int getScorePlayer1()
      Gets the score of Player 1.
      Returns:
      The score of Player 1.

    • isPlayer1Turn

      public boolean isPlayer1Turn()
      Checks if it is currently Player 1's turn.
      Returns:
      true if it is Player 1's turn, false otherwise.

      Gets the score of Player 2.

    • incrementPointByName

      public void incrementPointByName(String playerName, int points)
      Increments the points of a player by the specified amount.
      Parameters:
      playerName - The name of the player whose points are to be incremented.
      points - The number of points to be added to the player's score.

    • getWinner

      public Player getWinner()
      Retrieves the winner of the game.
      Returns:
      The player object representing the winner, or null if the game is not over.
